short_summary: Request for Supply Arrangement to establish multiple supply arrangements for remediation construction services at northern contaminated sites projects in various remote locations in Nunavut, Northwest Territories and Yukon Territory.  These Supply Arrangements holders will selectively be asked to provide proposals for specific projects in the future.
description: This RFSA (Request for Supply Arrangement) aims to establish multiple supply arrangements for remediation construction services at northern contaminated sites projects in various remote locations in Nunavut, Northwest Territories and Yukon Territory. This RFSA allows suppliers to submit their responses at a time of their convenience. PSPC will evaluate responses upon receipt and existing qualified suppliers will not be required to submit a new arrangement. There is no maximum number of supply arrangements that may be issued as a result of this RFSA.
full_summary:
**EW479-192534-C – Remediation Construction Services for Northern Contaminated Sites**

### Notice Details:
* **Reference Number:** WS4108853490-Doc4157206567
* **Solicitation Number:** WS4108853490
* **Publication Date:** November 15, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** February 28, 2025 @ 2:00 PM EST
* **Amendment Date:** December 29, 2023
* **Notice Type:** Request for Supply Arrangement
* **Procurement Category:** Construction and Engineering Services (CNST)
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive – Open Bidding

### Supply Arrangement Summary:
A Request for Supply Arrangement (RFSA) has been issued to establish multiple supply arrangements for remediation construction services at northern contaminated sites projects in various remote locations in Nunavut, Northwest Territories, and Yukon Territory.

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) intends to selectively tender future Requests for Proposal (RFPs) among this pool of successful supply arrangement holders. There is no maximum number of supply arrangements that may be issued as a result of this RFSA.

### Eligibility and Qualifications:
Eligible suppliers are encouraged to submit their responses at any time, as PSPC will evaluate responses upon receipt.

### Notice Documents:
The RFSA document is available on Ariba Discovery and CanadaBuys.

### Contact Information:
Ben Wong, PSPC, (he/him)
[wong.ben@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:wong.ben@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Additional Information:
This RFSA is subject to the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA) and other applicable trade agreements.

The collaboration on this RFSA is open to bidders from various countries, including but not limited to Canada, the European Union, and other Nations that are signatories to the aforementioned trade agreements.

### Service Description:
The RFSA aims to secure supply arrangements for remediation construction services that include environmental remediation, and hazardous materials management.

The services will be required for various northern contaminated sites projects throughout Nunavut, Northwest Territories and Yukon Territory. PSPC will select suppliers based on their qualifications and expertise in providing remediation construction services.

Please note that this RFSA replaces any previous RFSA for the same purpose, and it will remain open until further notice. Suppliers are encouraged to check the administrative contact information regularly for
